snippet: A bumper harvest and a surge in emergency food aid have ended a famine in Somalia that killed tens of thousands of people, the United Nations said on Friday.
abstract: United Nations says that the famine that has killed tens of thousands of people in Somalia has ended, thanks to a bumper harvest and a surge in emergency food deliveries; UN officials warn that conditions are still precarious, with many Somalis dying of hunger and more than two million still needing emergency rations to survive.
lead_paragraph: A bumper harvest and a surge in emergency food aid have ended a famine in Somalia that killed tens of thousands of people, the United Nations said on Friday.

headline.seo: U.N. Says Somalia Famine Has Ended, but Crisis Isn’t Over
headline.main: U.N. Says Somalia Famine Has Ended, but Warns That Crisis Isn’t Over
headline.print_headline: U.N. Says Somalia Famine Has Ended, but Warns That Nation’s Crisis Isn’t Over
